page.title: 01Burford & District
page.content: Burford(pop 1371) is an attractive Cotswold town by the River Windrush which flows eastwards through the West Oxfordshire parishes of Taynton, Fulbrook,Widford & Swinbrook.Burford an ancient defended settlement has grown round its magnicicent church & flanking routeways,the A40 & A361. Previously weavers,quarrymen,masons, tanners and farmers worked here.Burford with many inns became a coaching centre & halting place for the landed gentry. With the advent of the railway Burford & its surrounding villages grew into a thriving farming community until the rural decline of late Victorian times. Now Burford & district have become a major tourist attraction with interesting buildings & their historical associations,good inns & shops & beautiful rolling countryside.
